archdesc.runner: Special Collections, Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: Papers of Charles D. Tibbetts who died in Phoebus, Virginia in 1924 at the age of 94 or 96. The collection includes a few financial and personal documents and personal correspondence, but it is mostly correspondence between people involved with Tibbetts' inheritance. Tibbetts enlisted in the army in Richmond, Virginia when he was 17 years old and fought in the Mexican War. Genealogy of the Tibbetts, Stover and Cunningham families are partially shown in the letters searching for heirs.
did.origination: Tibbetts, Charles D., 1827-1924Carson, Susie B.Cunningham, W.N.Fuller, P. A.Hahn, Virginia K.Power, W. H. arrangement

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to all researchers.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Before reproducing or quoting from any materials, in whole or in part, permission must be obtained from the Special Collections Research Center, and the holder of the copyright, if not Swem Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Charles D. Tibbetts Papers, Special Collections Research Center, Swem Library, College of William and Mary.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The materials were acquired by Special Collections Research Center on 00/00/2008.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: The papers were located in the old Digges House in Mathews, Virginia.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Probably born in Virginia.  Died in Phoebus, Virginia.  Participated in the Mexican War. Further information about this individual or organization may be available in the Special Collections Research Center Wiki: http://scrc.swem.wm.edu/wiki/index.php/Charles D. Tibbetts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Papers of Charles D. Tibbetts who died in Phoebus, Virginia in 1924 at the age of 94 or 96. The collection includes a few financial and personal documents and personal correspondence, but it is mostly correspondence between people involved with Tibbetts' inheritance. Tibbetts enlisted in the army in Richmond, Virginia when he was 17 years old and fought in the Mexican War. Genealogy of the Tibbetts, Stover and Cunningham families are partially shown in the letters searching for heirs.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: This Collection is indexed under the following controlled access subject terms.

controlaccess.head: Topical Term:
controlaccess.subject: United States. Army--Appointments, promotions, salaries, etc.
